intro: Phyteuma confusum, commonly known as the confused phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of pale blue to violet flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and often branched. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
